summary: This is an email exchange between an Assistant United States Attorney and another recipient regarding the return of a discovery drive from Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys following his death. The drive is placed in a paralegal file for the case, consistent with a protective order.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email who received and secured the returned discovery drive from Epstein's attorneys.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the case; his attorneys returned a discovery drive to the prosecution following his death.

connections.description: Epstein's attorneys returned discovery materials to the prosecutor's office following Epstein's death, as part of legal proceedings.

events.title: Return of Epstein discovery drive
events.description: An envelope containing a discovery drive previously held by Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys is returned to the U.S. Attorney's office, consistent with a protective order, following Epstein's death.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A discovery drive from the Jeffrey Epstein case was returned by his attorneys to the U.S. Attorney's office following Epstein's death.
The return was handled in accordance with the terms of a protective order governing the case materials.
The correspondence confirms ongoing administrative handling of case materials after Epstein's death in August 2019.
